detaileddescription.para:
Signal function of the tileview
tileview
pointer to a tileview object
sign
a signal type from lv_signal_t enum
param
pointer to a signal specific variable
LV_RES_OK: the object is not deleted in the function; LV_RES_INV: the object is deleted

Signal function of the tileview scrollable
tileview
pointer to the scrollable part of the tileview object
sign
a signal type from lv_signal_t enum
param
pointer to a signal specific variable
LV_RES_OK: the object is not deleted in the function; LV_RES_INV: the object is deleted

Called when the user releases an element of the tileview after dragging it.
tileview
pointer to a tileview object

Create a tileview object
par
pointer to an object, it will be the parent of the new tileview
copy
pointer to a tileview object, if not NULL then the new object will be copied from it
pointer to the created tileview

Register an object on the tileview. The register object will able to slide the tileview
tileview
pointer to a Tileview object
element
pointer to an object

Set the valid position's indices. The scrolling will be possible only to these positions.
tileview
pointer to a Tileview object
valid_pos
array width the indices. E.g. lv_point_t p[] = {{0,0}, {1,0}, {1,1}, {LV_COORD_MIN, LV_COORD_MIN}}; Must be closed with {LV_COORD_MIN, LV_COORD_MIN}. Only the pointer is saved so can't be a local variable.

memberdef.argsstring: (lv_obj_t *tileview, lv_coord_t x, lv_coord_t y, lv_anim_enable_t anim)
memberdef.name: lv_tileview_set_tile_act

detaileddescription.para:
Set the tile to be shown
tileview
pointer to a tileview object
x
column id (0, 1, 2...)
y
line id (0, 1, 2...)
anim
LV_ANIM_ON: set the value with an animation; LV_ANIM_OFF: change the value immediately

Set a style of a tileview.
tileview
pointer to tileview object
type
which style should be set
style
pointer to a style

Get style of a tileview.
tileview
pointer to tileview object
type
which style should be get
style pointer to the style
